name: More Time On My Hands Multiple Choice Quiz | Newspapers & Magazines | 10 Questions

questions.text: Emperor Haile Selassie was 'Time' magazine's 'Man of the Year' for 1935. What religion did Selassie become the prime deity of?
questions.explanation:
Rastafarianism.

	Halie Selassie was Emperor of Ethiopia from 1930 until 1974. Among His titles were, Conquering Lion of the Tribe of Judah, King of Kings and Elect of God.

questions.text: 1937's 'Man of the Year' title went to a husband and wife. Who was the couple?
questions.explanation:
Generalissimo and Madame Chiang Kai-Shek.

	The Kai-Sheks led China during the colonialist invasions and occupations by Japan.

questions.text: According to 'Time', who made the biggest impact of 1945?
questions.explanation:
Harry S Truman.

	President Truman had, quite possibly the toughest presidential decision up to his time, which was the use of the atomic bomb.

questions.text: Which leader was voted 'Man of the Year' for 1953?
questions.explanation:
Konrad Adenauer.

	Konrad Adenauer was the first chancellor of West Germany, when the country was reformed after World War II. He was chancellor from 1949 until 1963.

questions.text: In 1956 the title 'Man of the Year' was given to a fighting group, what was it?
questions.explanation:
The Hungarian freedom fighter.

	This was as a result of the revolt of October 23rd, 1956, when the leadership, unable to control demonstrators called for Soviet help.

questions.text: Who was 'Time' magazine's 'Man of the Year' for 1957?
questions.explanation:
Nikita Krushchev.

	The Soviet Union took a clear lead in the 'Space Race' during 1957, with the successful launching of Sputnik.

questions.text: Which 'group' was 'Man of the Year' for 1969?
questions.explanation:
The Middle Americans.

	This was to honor the political clout of the recently 'discovered' middle class.

questions.text: Which European leader won the title 'Man of the Year' in 1970?
questions.explanation:
Willy Brandt.

	The West German Chancelor won for his efforts to turn Western Europe into a political, comercial, financial and military union.

questions.text: Which middle eastern leader was 'Man of the Year' for 1974?
questions.explanation:
King Faisal.

	The ruler of oil-rich Saudi Arabia was one of the most powerful men in the world. He was assassinated on March 25, 1975.

questions.text: Who was 'Time' magazine's 'Man of the Year' for 1996?
questions.explanation:
Dr David Ho.

	Dr Ho was named for his work in the field of infectious diseases, in particular HIV and AIDS.
